intro: Chaetostichium, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed orchid, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are characterized by their slender, often hairy stems and small, delicate leaves. They typically produce intricate, showy flowers with specialized structures that aid in pollination by insects. Chaetostichium species are primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Their botanical significance lies in their unique adaptations and role in their native ecosystems.
